title: [Phase1] Implement logos ls command
description: Enumerate .md files under sessions/ and display a human-readable table. Options: --tag <tag>, --since <date>, --json (structured JSON output with frontmatter + excerpt, for agent consumption).

title: Update USAGE.md template — add tasks section for agent reference
description:
Add the tasks section to the USAGE.md template that logos init generates.

## Scope
- The USAGE.md template embedded in cmd/init.go (or the template file used by init)

## What to add
Append to the existing ## Commands section:

## Tasks

Sessionの中で出てきたアクション・実装案・TODO項目をタスクとして保存できる。
タスクは必ずセッションに紐づく。セッションが「なぜ必要か」の根拠になる。

### When to create a task
- ユーザーが「タスクにして」「後でやる」「TODOにしておいて」と言ったとき
- エージェントが実装案・改善案・リファクタリング提案をしたとき
- セッション保存後に「この提案だけ残しておきたい」と判断したとき

### Workflow for creating a task
1. 現在のセッションが保存済みか確認（logos ls --json で最新取得）
2. task-template.md を読む（テンプレート構造を把握）
3. 会話から What / Why / Scope / Checklist を埋めたmdを生成
4. logos task create --session <session-filename> --stdin で保存

### Workflow for checking tasks
1. logos task ls --status open --json で未対応タスク一覧を取得
2. title と excerpt を読んで関連するタスクを判断
3. logos task refer <task> --with-session でタスクの詳細と背景を取得

### Commands
logos task ls --json
logos task ls --session <name>
logos task ls --status open
logos task refer <name>
logos task refer <name> --with-session
logos task create --session <name> --stdin
logos task create --session <name> --file <path>
logos task update <name> --status done
logos task update <name> --status in_progress
logos task update <name> --status done --force
logos task delete <name>
logos task search <keyword>

## Acceptance
- logos init generates USAGE.md that includes the tasks section
- go test ./cmd/... passes

title: [Phase2] Implement logos setup command
description: logos setup claude: append logos reference line to CLAUDE.md. logos setup cursor: append to .cursor/rules. logos setup aider: append to .aider.conf.yml. Distinction from init: init initializes .logosyncx/ itself, setup integrates with agent config files.

title: Implement internal/task/store.go — task file I/O and git operations
description:
Add Store type with all read/write operations for .logosyncx/tasks/ directory.

## Scope
- internal/task/store.go

## What to implement
Store struct with fields: dir (tasks/), sessionDir (sessions/), cfg (*config.Config)

Methods:
- List(f Filter) ([]*Task, error) — read all task files, apply filter
- Get(nameOrPartial string) (*Task, error) — partial match on filename, error if 0 or >1 match
- Save(t *Task, raw string) error — auto-fill id (t- prefix + 6-char hex) and date, write file, git add
- UpdateFields(nameOrPartial string, fields map[string]string) error — update frontmatter fields, overwrite, git add
- Delete(nameOrPartial string) error — delete file, git rm
- ResolveSession(partial string) (string, error) — partial match in sessions/ dir, error if 0 or >1 match

## Acceptance
- Unit tests using in-memory or temp-dir approach (matching sessions/store_test.go pattern)
- git add/rm failures emit warning, not error (file operation still succeeds)
- go test ./internal/task/... passes

title: [Phase2] Implement privacy filter
description: During logos save, detect patterns matching privacy.filter_patterns in config.json (API keys, personal info, etc.) and warn/mask them. Provide a set of default regex patterns out of the box.

title: [Phase1] Implement logos save command
description: Accept .md input via --file <path> or --stdin. Auto-fill frontmatter id/date if not present. Save to .logosyncx/sessions/ as <date>_<topic>.md. Auto-run git add via go-git. git commit/push is the user's responsibility. No interactive prompts (non-interactive use by agents).

title: Remove id/date from template.md (YAML parse error fix)
description: The current template.md contains {{id}} and {{date}} in the YAML frontmatter, but {{ is treated as a YAML flow mapping character, causing unmarshal errors when agents pass it to logos save.
acceptance_criteria:
- template.md no longer contains id/date fields
- USAGE.md notes that id/date are auto-filled by logos save
- logos save works correctly with the updated template

title: Implement config.json read/write
description: Load and save .logosyncx/config.json. Fields: version, project, agents_file, save.summary_sections, privacy.filter_patterns. Fill in default values when config does not exist.

title: Implement cmd/task.go — logos task subcommands
description:
Add all logos task subcommands using cobra.

## Scope
- cmd/task.go

## Commands to implement

### logos task create
Flags: --session <partial>, --file <path>, --stdin
Flow:
1. Resolve session via Store.ResolveSession (error if 0 or >1 match)
2. Read markdown from --file or --stdin
3. Parse frontmatter, auto-fill id/date, overwrite session field
4. Store.Save — write to tasks/<date>_<slug>.md (slug = title in kebab-case)
5. Validation: warn if title empty; error if status invalid

### logos task ls
Flags: --session, --status, --tag, --priority, --json
Human-readable: table with DATE | TITLE | STATUS | PRIORITY | SESSION
JSON: TaskJSON array with excerpt field

### logos task refer <partial>
Flags: --summary (show only config.tasks.summary_sections), --with-session (append linked session summary)

### logos task update <partial>
Flags: --status, --priority, --assignee
Special: --status done triggers confirmation + Store.Delete + git rm (skip confirm with --force)
Normal: update frontmatter fields via Store.UpdateFields + git add

### logos task delete <partial>
Flags: --force
Confirmation prompt with title + status before delete
Store.Delete + git rm

### logos task search <keyword>
Flags: --status, --tag
Apply Filter{Keyword: keyword, Status: ..., Tags: ...} then print table

## Acceptance
- Integration tests for each command (temp dir with fake tasks)
- Error message format matches error handling policy in design doc
- go test ./cmd/... passes

title: Go project initial setup
description: go mod init, add cobra/go-git/goldmark/yaml.v3 dependencies, create cmd/ pkg/ internal/ directory structure. Binary name is logos.

title: [Phase1] Implement logos init command
description: Generate .logosyncx/ directory, config.json, USAGE.md, and template.md. Append 'Use logos CLI...' line to AGENTS.md (or CLAUDE.md). Show an error message if already initialized.

title: [Phase2] Implement logos sync command
description: Scan sessions/ and rebuild the index. Warn if old sessions exist that are missing sections listed in summary_sections, or when .md files were manually added.

title: [Phase3] Implement MCP server (fallback)
description: MCP server for environments without shell access (e.g. Claude Desktop). Provides tools equivalent to logos ls / logos refer / logos search. Design note: agents with shell access should use the CLI; MCP is a supplementary fallback.

title: Add Makefile with build/install/test targets
description: There is no Makefile in the project. Developers must manually run go build -o logos . and then set PATH. A Makefile with install target would simplify the workflow.
acceptance_criteria:
- Makefile exists with build, install, and test targets
- make install copies binary to /usr/local/bin/logos
- make test runs go test ./...

title: [Phase2] Implement logos status command
description: Display unsaved/uncommitted session information. Integrate with git status to list newly added or modified files under .logosyncx/sessions/.

title: Update config.json schema — add tasks section with default values
description:
Extend Config struct and default config generation to support tasks configuration.

## Scope
- internal/config/ (or wherever Config is defined)
- cmd/init.go (default config generation)

## Changes to Config struct
Add Tasks field:
  Tasks struct {
    DefaultStatus   string   json:"default_status"   // default: "open"
    DefaultPriority string   json:"default_priority" // default: "medium"
    SummarySections []string json:"summary_sections" // default: ["What", "Checklist"]
  } json:"tasks"

## Usage
- DefaultStatus / DefaultPriority used in Store.Save when frontmatter fields are empty
- SummarySections used by logos task refer --summary and --with-session (task side)

## Default config.json output from logos init
{
  "version": "1",
  "project": "<project-name>",
  "agents_file": "AGENTS.md",
  "save": {
    "summary_sections": ["Summary", "Key Decisions"]
  },
  "tasks": {
    "default_status": "open",
    "default_priority": "medium",
    "summary_sections": ["What", "Checklist"]
  },
  "privacy": {
    "filter_patterns": []
  }
}

## Acceptance
- Config struct has Tasks field with correct JSON tags
- logos init generates config.json with tasks section
- Store.Save uses config defaults when fields are empty
- logos task refer --summary uses config.tasks.summary_sections
- go test ./... passes

title: [Phase1] Implement logos refer command
description: Search for a .md file by session name (exact or partial match) and print its content. --summary flag returns only sections listed in config's summary_sections (saves tokens). Show a list of candidates when multiple matches exist.

title: Implement internal/task/filter.go — task filtering logic
description:
Add Filter struct and Apply function for filtering task lists.

## Scope
- internal/task/filter.go

## What to implement
Filter struct:
  Session  string   // partial match on session filename
  Status   Status
  Priority Priority
  Tags     []string
  Keyword  string   // for task search: matches title, tags, excerpt

Apply(tasks []*Task, f Filter) []*Task function:
- Session: substring match on task.Session field
- Status: exact match (empty = no filter)
- Priority: exact match (empty = no filter)
- Tags: task must have at least one matching tag
- Keyword: case-insensitive substring match on title, any tag, excerpt

## Acceptance
- Unit tests covering each filter dimension independently
- Unit test for combined filter (multiple fields)
- go test ./internal/task/... passes

title: Implement internal/task/task.go — Task struct and frontmatter parsing
description:
Add the core task package with Task struct, frontmatter parsing, and excerpt extraction.

## Scope
- internal/task/task.go

## What to implement
- Task struct with YAML frontmatter fields: id, date, title, status, priority, session, tags, assignee
- TaskJSON struct for --json output
- Status constants: StatusOpen, StatusInProgress, StatusCancelled
- Priority constants: PriorityHigh, PriorityMedium, PriorityLow
- Frontmatter parsing from markdown file content
- Excerpt extraction from ## What section (first 200-300 chars)

## Acceptance
- Unit tests for frontmatter parsing
- Unit tests for excerpt extraction from ## What section
- go test ./internal/task/... passes

title: Update cmd/init.go — create tasks/ dir and task-template.md on logos init
description:
Extend logos init to initialize the tasks infrastructure.

## Scope
- cmd/init.go (existing file)

## Changes
1. Create .logosyncx/tasks/ directory if it does not exist
2. Write .logosyncx/task-template.md with the following content:

---
id: {{id}}
date: {{date}}
title: {{title}}
status: open
priority: medium
session: {{session}}
tags: []
assignee:
---

## What
<!-- このタスクで何をするか。具体的なアクションを記述 -->

## Why
<!-- なぜ必要か。セッションのどの議論・提案から生まれたか -->

## Scope
<!-- 変更対象のファイル・コンポーネントの見立て（任意） -->

## Checklist
- [ ] 

## Notes
<!-- 実装上の注意点、参考リンクなど（任意） -->

## Acceptance
- logos init creates tasks/ directory
- logos init creates task-template.md with correct content
- Existing init behavior is unchanged
- go test ./cmd/... passes

title: Implement session data model and file I/O
description: Read/write Markdown session files with frontmatter (id/date/topic/tags/agent/related). Parse frontmatter with goldmark + yaml.v3. Extract excerpt logic (first 200-300 characters of the Summary section).

title: Change Session.Date to *time.Time to accept empty/omitted values
description: Session.Date is currently time.Time, which rejects empty strings at the YAML unmarshal level — before the auto-fill logic in logos save can run. This causes a parse failure whenever the date field is blank or absent.
acceptance_criteria:
- Session.Date is *time.Time with yaml:"date,omitempty"
- Empty or omitted date fields parse without error
- FileName() and save.go handle nil Date by falling back to time.Now()
- All existing tests pass (go test ./...)

title: [Phase2] Interactive UI for logos ls (fzf-style)
description: Interactive session list and filtering UI using bubbletea. Launches when logos ls is run without arguments. Falls back to standard non-interactive output when --json or --tag flags are provided.

title: [Phase1] Implement logos search command
description: Case-insensitive keyword match against topic, tags, and excerpt. Combinable with --tag flag. Primarily a human-facing helper command. Semantic search is handled by the agent itself via ls --json, so simple string matching is sufficient here.

title: Improve logos save error messages with actionable hints
description: When logos save fails to parse the session frontmatter, it surfaces the raw YAML internal error, which is hard for agents to act on. If the input contains {{ the error should include a concrete hint.
acceptance_criteria:
- When input contains {{ and parse fails, error message includes: 'Hint: remove id/date from frontmatter (they are auto-filled by logos save)'
- Other parse errors are unchanged

title: [Phase3] Session cross-linking and dependency view
description: Visualize the session reference graph based on the related field in frontmatter. Display a list of related sessions when running logos refer.

title: [Phase3] Auto-update knowledge/ directory
description: On logos save or logos sync, automatically extract and update architecture.md / decisions.md / conventions.md from session files. Design the extraction using rule-based logic without calling an LLM (e.g. append Key Decisions sections to decisions.md).
